channel.title: Project Discover â€“ Discover Analytics
channel.description: Recent content in Discover Analytics on Project Discover

item.title: Docs: Overview
item.description:
A set of KPIs allow you to quickly visualize

  • Nb of Events
  • Nb of Cases
  • Nb of Variants
  • Nb of Activities
  • Median and average case duration

    • Open cases are also visualized on a timeline, allowing you to filter start and end times using the zoom slider and the filter panel.

item.title: Docs: Variants
item.description:
Variants can be explored, focusing on:

  • Distribution by frequency or performance
  • Top frequency: discover the most frequent paths corresponding to your 80% cases.
  • Bottom performance: discover the worst cases in terms of duration and identify the outliers.

    • Select one or more variants from the table and visualize the corresponding process map.

item.title: Docs: Process Map
item.description:
Typical features include:

  • Node color represent a metric (frequency or performance)
  • Zoom in and out to explore the process
  • Support of multiple layouts
  • Ability to select nodes and edges for filtering purpose
  • Configurable labels on edges (including Nb events & duration)

item.title: Docs: Activities
item.description:
Two main categorizations are proposed:

  • by frequency
  • by performance

    • Each set of visualizations include a time distribution, and a tree map representing resources performing the activities.

    Select one or more activities to drill down into details.

item.title: Docs: Resource Graph
item.description:
The purpose is to help discover some patterns related to how resources are involved and interact with each other in processes.

A table lists resources ranked by number of activities performed.

  • select one or more resources to see details, including the list of activities performed by the selection.

    • The graph represent resources as nodes and connections as edges. A connection between two resources represents two consecutive activities in the same case. Of course, an edge can represent more than one occurrences of such connection, for one or more cases.

    A filter panel allows

  • setting a minimum number of activities, as a way to filter resources
  • setting a minimum number of activities, as a way to filter resources and connections

item.title: Docs: Reference Model
item.description:
Here's how it works:

  • Initially the reference model is empty.
  • As you discover variants, you can Add one or more to the reference model.
  • The reference model is then persisted in the backend, therefore next time you open the analysis it will appear.
  • Once set, you can check compliance of the cases against that reference set.
  • At any time, you can add/remove variants from the reference model.

    • Setting the reference model does not require any modeling. Instead, it follows a discovery approach, expecting the data and cases to contain at least one occurrence of them.

item.title: Docs: Compliance
item.description:
A variant is qualified as non compliant if it doesn't follow any of the variants that constitute the reference model. Only the paths are considered for compliance checking.

What you can see at a glance is:

  • The level of non compliance in the form of the number of variants, and % of cases that aren't compliant with the reference set.
  • A table showing all non compliant variants
  • A visual representation of the differences between the reference model and a selected non compliant variant

    • The table of non compliant variants can be sorted by any of these columns:

  • Degree of non compliance, expressed as the number of difference between the variant (row) and the reference model
  • Number of cases
  • Duration metrics

    • You can select a variant in the table and perform the following actions:

  • Visualize the process compared to the reference model.
  • Mark the variant as checked so that next time you open the analysis you won't need to inspect it again.
  • Raise an investigation so that the non compliance can be escalated, validated and the root cause problem resolved so that it doesn't occur again in the future
  • Track the status of the investigation

    • Graph Color Codes

item.title: Docs: Cases
item.description:
usually cases get selected from a variant selection

It allows to drill down into the details of each case and view their event history. Cases are listed and can be compared visually by selecting them.

item.title: Docs: Filters
item.description: This template is a starting point. It is designed as generic, so that you can use it against any data source. You will find default visualizations for Process Maps, Variants, Cases, Resources and many more.

item.title: Docs: How To's
item.description:
Can I customize Visualizations

Absolutely. This is even recommended to fulfill your Business use case!
You can use TIBCO Cloud Spotfire Analyst to edit the DXP.

For example you can:

  • Change visualizations (eg. from bar chart to line chart)
  • Add or remove visualizations, for example to best represent custom attributes such as a regional attribute best represented on a map chart.
  • Add more data sources, correlated with the business processes, such as CRM data. You can then define relations between the data tables
  • add more data preparation, data science, AI/ML
  • Add or remove tabs
  • and much more !

    • The template is stored in the TIBCO Spotfire Library. The link can be found and configured under the Settings configuration tab, in the analytics section.

    Can I maximize Visualizations

    Yes. Every single visualization can be maximized by clicking on the corresponding symbol on the top right corner of the visualization header.

    Can I raise Investigations

    Yes. In the Compliance tab, you can select a variant from the non compliant variants table, and then click on the +Investigation button. Fill a short and detailed description and a new case will be created.

    Can I track the Status

    Yes. The variants table in the Compliance tab contains a Status column allowing you to track the status of that variant inspection.

    The status is one of:

  • unchecked (default) Enabled by clicking on the "Uncheck" button
  • checked: means inspected. Enabled by clicking on the "Check" button.
  • Compliance or Improvement: Means an investigation has been raised.

    • In case an investigation is created, you can find tracking information in the next two columns:

  • Case Type: subject of the case (eg. Variant)
  • Case Status: status of the case in the case management component.
